緊.definition: tight; strict; close at hand; near; urgent; tense; hard up; short of money; to tighten

緊咬不放.definition: (idiom) unwilling to let go; like a dog with a bone; dogged

緊密配合.definition: to coordinate closely; to act in close partnership with

緊巴.definition: tight (i.e. lacking money); hard up; same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴

緊巴巴.definition: tight fitting; hard up (i.e. lacking money)

緊張.definition: nervous; keyed up; intense; tense; strained; in short supply; scarce; CL:陣|阵[zhen4]

緊扣.definition: to stick closely to (a topic or theme etc)

緊接.definition: to follow immediately afterwards; immediately adjacent

緊握.definition: to hold firmly, not let go

緊湊渺子線圈.pinyin: Jin3 cou4 Miao3 zi3 Xian4 quan1

緊箍咒.definition: the Band-tightening Spell (in 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]); a spell or incantation for controlling sb

緊縮.definition: (economics) to reduce; to curtail; to cut back; to tighten; austerity; tightening; crunch

緊繃.definition: to stretch taut; (of muscles etc) taut; strained; tense

緊衣縮食.definition: see 節衣縮食|节衣缩食[jie2 yi1 suo1 shi2]

緊裹.definition: to wrap tightly; to wind tightly; to bind; close-fitting (clothes)

緊要關頭.definition: urgent and important moment (idiom); critical juncture

緊貼.definition: to stick close to; to press up against

緊跟.definition: to follow precisely; to comply with

緊迫盯人.definition: to keep a close eye on sb (idiom)

緊逼.definition: to press hard; to close in on

緊鄰.definition: to be right next to; close neighbor

緊鑼密鼓.definition: lit. urgent beating of gongs and drums (idiom); fig. to urgently prepare for an upcoming event

緊閉.definition: to close securely; tightly closed; secure

緊隨其後.definition: to follow closely behind sb or sth (idiom)

緊靠.definition: to be right next to; to lean closely against
